WorkItem.Description:
Great library! I found a small bug: I'm binding TreeViewEx.SelectedItems to a property on a view model. When WPF initializes my user control, the view model has not yet been bound, and so WPF resolves the binding to a null value. This causes a crash in TreeViewExItem, line 443:

```
if (ParentTreeView.SelectedItems.Contains(DataContext)) // ParentTreeView.SelectedItems is null
```

This can be fixed by changing line 443 to:

```
if (ParentTreeView.SelectedItems != null && ParentTreeView.SelectedItems.Contains(DataContext))
```
WorkItem.Summary: TreeViewExItem crashes if DataContext is bound after initialization
